ABC's`` World News Tonight'' Monday, former President Bush 's aide acknowledges to Diane Sawyer that`` it's possible'' not sending more troops to Iraq early on constitutes the biggest mistake of the war. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld says. When Diane Sawyer noted President Bush has written that cutting troop levels in Iraq was`` the most important failure in the execution of the war,'' Donald Rumsfeld called that assessment`` interesting.''

Asked to choose his best game of the season, Michael Vick selected the playoff game against the Packers, despite three sacks, an interception on the final throw and a season-ending loss. Honestly, it might sound crazy, but( the Packers game) I just felt so much confidence, Michael Vick told PFW.`` I was just so in tune with everything: the protection, the blitz, where it was coming from, all my progressions, where everybody was supposed to be lined up.

[...] A visit to Tunisia by defence secretary Donald Rumsfeld in February 2006 proves even more revealing:`` We have a very long relationship with Tunisia,'' Donald Rumsfeld remarked after the meetings. Tunisia is a moderate Muslim nation that has been and is today providing very constructive leadership in the world. The struggle that's taking place within that faith is a serious one, an important one. There's a very small number of violent extremists on the one side against a broad, overwhelming majority of people who are moderate. , well-known egyptologist Zahi Hawass , on Thursday played down accounts of the break-in at the Museum and warned against`` rumours.'' In a posting on his blog, Zahi Hawass said the incident at the museum resulted in 70 broken objects, all of which can be restored. `` I want people to know that after nine days of protests, the monuments are safe,'' Zahi Hawass said.`` If anything happens, I will announce it.''
